children.subject:
I cannot speak for 54 as I have not taken or heard anything about it.

Currently in EE16B rn...(I took EE16A FA18 w/Ranade & Stoj.)

I personally would take EE16A it is not that bad looking back at it. Professor Ranade is a great lecturer. The work load is somewhat heavy, but if you fully understand the material it is not that bad. The whole point of the EE16AB series as Prof Sahai says is to teach you how to think. The series prepares you for many cs and ee upper divs, especially for cs70. I also think ee16b would be relatively difficult without a strong circuits background gained in EE16A. 

Also Sahai said that students who have not taken 16a are not a "very supported population... people should take 16a before they take 16b"

just something to consider.

Was the workload for 16A very significantly higher than that of 54? I know there is a lab for 16A, but are the homework’s generally much harder and longer for 16A than those of 54? I know there are self grades for 16A homework so I feel like it isn’t essential to get everything right on the homework’s, which might make them a little more manageable. But overall you seem to would suggest 16A even though it is a higher workload, with my potential schedule? Thanks a lot for the help! :)

The lab was easy as long as you showed up I thought, and the homework was not significantly harder at all because there was much more support from the staff.  Most peopel for EE 16A got good grades on the homework as I remember. I took EE 16A before math 54 and did much better in 16a because I found that there was more support and energy from the staff whereas math 54 felt like a very overflowed lower div math class that I was not very interested in because it was not properly organized / little application and the exams were like half true and false which just wasn't exciting and I don't think I learned very much overall. The labs and homeworks were fun for 16A, but again I only have one perspective

I took both and took 54 with Teleman and was not the greatest fan. I found EE 16A a much more engaging class and interesting applications. Math 54 had a lower workload but also I think if you put in the time EE 16A is easier to get a good grade in.

I loved Math 54, but if you are taking 16B, I would HIGHLY recommend 16A. "Self-studying circuits" will help you generally slide through the course, but you are going to struggle a lot more in 16B if you haven't taken 16A. However, if it's going to be your last semester class, and you don't care about grades/doing well in lab, math 54 is a more viable option. I would still recommend 16A (I haven't taken 54 in Teleman but I think the 16A professors might be more engaging), but if you are really interested in math, I would recommend 54. 

16A workload is greater than 54 workload, but getting an A is probably about the same level of difficulty (not sure)

I have taken Math 54 with Teleman in Fall 2018. To be honest, I self-studied the whole course with the help of the discussion sessions and my great GSI. Taking Math 54 with Teleman is not fun. His lecture is a bit confused. However, getting a good grade in Math 54 is pretty easy. This being said, I still plan to take ee 16a this semester for taking ee 16b later.

history.content: Next semester, Gireeja Ranade and Bernhard E Boser are teaching EE 16A, and Constantin Teleman is teaching Math 54. I will need to take EE 16B eventually (probably my last semester in Senior year), and I will be a junior next semester. I am also planning on taking 61C and Data 100 next semester, and so I was wondering if anyone could comment on the workload of EE 16A vs that of Math 54. If I do take Math 54, I will self study circuits before EE 16B. I am more concerned with trying to not have an overwhelming workload next semester, and I think that from what I've heard, Math 54 might have an overall lower workload than EE 16A. If anyone could share their opinions on the workloads between the classes I would REALLY appreciate it!! :)
history.subject: Deciding on Math 54 vs EE 16A
